{{Infobox comedian | image = Tony Law, Edinburgh Fringe.jpg | name = Tony Law | imagesize = | caption = Law in 2012 | pseudonym = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1969|9|20|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Lacombe, Alberta|Lacombe]], [[Alberta]], Canada | death_date = | death_place = | medium = [[Television]], [[Stand-up comedy|Stand-up]] | nationality = [[Canadians|Canadian]] | active = 2002-present | genre = [[Observational comedy]], [[Surreal humour]] | subject = [[Current events]], [[Human interaction]] | influences = | influenced = | spouse = Storm Davison | notable_work = | website = | footnotes = | module = }}
'''Tony Law''' (born 20 September 1969) is a [[Canadians|Canadian]] [[stand-up comedian]]. Originally from [[Lacombe, Alberta|Lacombe]], [[Alberta]], he has been based in [[London]], [[United Kingdom]] since the age of 19.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://soundcloud.com/conversationhat/se2ep9|title=The Conversation Hat Podcast: Se2ep9 ft. Tony Law |publisher=Stabbed Panda Productions |date=2017-05-28 |accessdate=2017-10-31}}</ref> He lives in [[Islington]] with his family.
He is known for his highly surreal material and delivery, and eclectic historical style of dress, favouring boots with turned-up jeans and a Viking/explorer style of hair. Many of his stand-up routines are [[ad libitum|ad-lib]] and built around various subjects that he has thought of, but not planned a routine about. His routines are often built around fictional and surreal situations.
==Early life== Law was born on 20 September 1969 in [[Lacombe, Alberta|Lacombe]], [[Alberta]], Canada. He described his younger self as a "dickhead".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WvYWWQubFO4 |title=[HD] 8 out of 10 Cats S15E04 |publisher=YouTube |date=2013-02-09 |accessdate=2015-03-05}}</ref>
==Career== A lot of Law's earlier material featured tales of his time-travelling exploits in the company of his sausage dog, Cartridge Davison. Cartridge is the eponymous "Dog Of Time" from his [[Edinburgh]] show of the same name, and has appeared with Law on ITV's ''Comedy Cuts'' TV show. Time travel has featured less in Law's sets of late, but still makes an appearance. Notably in his podcast with John-Luke Roberts, The Tony Law Tapes.<ref>{{cite web | title = The Tony Law Tapes | url =http://www.tonylawtapes.co.uk}}</ref>
In 2002 he was a regular panellist on the [[Channel 4]] comedy quiz show ''Does Doug Know?''. He also appeared in a series of television adverts for [[Gala Bingo]] and has had TV exposure on ''Edinburgh & Beyond'' and ''[[Comedy Cuts]]''.
Law performed on ''[[Russell Howard's Good News]]'' in April 2011 as part of one of the extended episodes called ''Russell Howard's Good News Extra''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chortle.co.uk/video/2011/04/26/13183/tony_law_on_russell_howards_good_news |title=Tony Law on Russell Howard's Good News : Videos 2011 : Chortle : The UK Comedy Guide |publisher=Chortle |date=2011-04-26 |accessdate=2015-03-05}}</ref> On 17 October 2011, he also appeared on the satirical music-based panel game ''[[Never Mind the Buzzcocks]]''.
In 2011–2012, he toured his comedy show ''Tony Law: Go Mr Tony Go!''. In August 2012, Tony returned to the Edinburgh Fringe to perform his new show, ''Tony Law: Maximum Nonsense''. The show was nominated for best comedy show at the [[Edinburgh Comedy Awards]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Tim Clark |url=http://www.suchsmallportions.com/news/edinburgh-comedy-awards-dr-brown-josie-long-james-acaster-tony-law-claudia-odoherty-and-pappys- |title=Edinburgh Comedy Awards: Dr Brown, Josie Long, James Acaster, Tony Law, Claudia O'Doherty and Pappys nominated |publisher=Such Small Portions |date=2012-08-22 |accessdate=2015-03-05}}</ref>
He appeared on the BBC One show ''[[Have I Got News for You]]'', a satire panel show, on 1 November 2013, hosted by [[Kirsty Young]]. In November 2012 he appeared on ''[[8 Out of 10 Cats]]'', and returned to that show on 8 February 2013.<ref>{{cite web | title = 8 out 10 Cats Episode Guide | url =http://epguides.com/8outof10Cats/|publisher=Epguides.com|accessdate=2015-03-05}}</ref> In February–March 2013 he appeared in [[Comedy Central UK]]'s [[The Alternative Comedy Experience]]. In 2014, the [[British Comedy Guide]] revealed that Law is set to appear in a [[British Broadcasting Corporation|BBC]] sitcom pilot entitled ''Tools''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.comedy.co.uk/guide/pilots/tools/ |title=Tools - Pilot - British Comedy Guide |publisher=Comedy.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2015-03-05}}</ref>
